text: If you have a hard drive dock plugged in via usb so you can access the hard drive in the dock from your computer. is that hard drive considered "mounted"?
Yes
It shows up as mounted on my Mac when I do that
But what are you trying to do it?
:thinking_face:
Looking into cloud storage again
backblaze and crashplan and all the other popular ones don't back up mounted drives...
Ah
Cloud storage is tough
But they say they back up external drives
Hmm...
I think they might mean remotely mounted drives
That's what I would think.
You could just try backblaze
Isn't it a 14 day free trial or something?
I think so. I have a dock and a 2TB drive so maybe ill try that
Good plan
How do you organize your files?
Between drives
Synology does it for me. When you set it up you can pick how you want the drives to be setup raid 0, 1, 2, etc...
I just told it to make my 2 3TB drives into 1 6TB drive
and it takes care of the rest, so to me it just looks like I have one big 6TB drive
Gotcha. How do you organize your files then(in terms of folders)? Do you have a certain folder structure?
Yeah, movies folder, shows, documentaries, stand up comedy
Gotcha
Documentaries and Stand up don’t go into movies?
You don’t store anything but Video?
Nope, just video. and I mean you could put them all together but I feel like documentaries, stand up, movies, and shows are different enough to keep separated, but that's just me
Gotcha
I've thought about going on a music downloading binge, but spotify has everything id want, easily accessible, cheap, legal

Great example of software that removes the need for piracy in my opinion lol it's not worth my time to download 10,000+ songs when I can just search for anything I want on spotify and listen to it whenever i want wherever I am
Right. I agree. I thought about it but decided against it although I do have a few albums for whatever reason .
This is my file structure:

```.
├── Data Warehouse               # What I decided to call my Storage Warehouse
│   ├── Audio                    # GarageBand projects, Albums, Podcasts, etc.
│   ├── Movies                
│   ├── TV
│   ├── Documents                # The usual Docs, Spreadsheets, etc.
│   ├── Photos                   # Wallpapers, personal photos, dank memes
│   ├── Projects                 # Any web or Xcode projects. Any development projects in general.
│   ├── XXX                      # 100% NOT porn...```
Movies doesn’t have any categories
TV has a folder for each Show
XXX is roughly categorized and I run it through Gemini II to make sure there are no dupes.
Dupes are annoying when I’m going through a sesh on my TV
lol
haha
I have a folder called ( . Y . ) with all my NOT porn videos, but it's not on my NAS. Too afraid ill accidentally somehow move it into my plex folder for everyone to see
Lolol
